            About
            Bradley J. O’Guinn is a doctoral student in the School of
            Criminal Justice at the University of Cincinnati. His
            research focuses on policing and the geographic
            concentration of crime. He frequently uses his skills in
            R and ArcGIS to analyze
            large amounts of data and identify high crime places. His
            work has been featured in Crime and Delinquency and
            Police Practice and Research.
            
            
            Education
            University of Cincinnati | Cincinnati,
            OH
            Ph.D. in Criminal Justice | August 2019 - Present
            Southern Illinois University Carbondale
            | Carbondale, IL
            M.A. in Criminology & Criminal Justice | August 2018
            - May 2019
            B.A. in Criminology & Criminal Justice | August 2016
            - May 2018
            
            
            Experience
            University of Cincinnati | Cincinnati,
            OH
            Digital Futures Fellow | August 2022 - Present
            Graduate Research Assistant | August 2019 - July 2022
